availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of B. Faris and A. B. Faris. Resident in Christian County in 1850. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, corporal, and quartermaster sergeant from September 23, 1861, to June 3, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 308.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994050, Muhlenberg County Deaths.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0028.
Find A Grave, “W. H. Farris (1840-1876)," Memorial #142663337, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/142663337 (accessed on May 22, 2018).
